result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gorje M Ramirez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Gorje M Ramirez in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 14CF210, 14CM105, & 14CF81.   Rights/Elements.  In case 14CF210  All charges dismissed but read in.  In case 14CF81 All charges dismissed but read in.  In 14CM105  Defendant plead no contest to Cts 1, & 2.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Sentencing withheld, placed on probation for 2 years each count. Must comply with CHIPS case.  All other conditions set by agent.  Ct. 1 $ 443.00 costs.  Ct. 2 $443.00 costs.   6 month review.  Jail credit 3 days.  Dismiss but read in Counts 3 & 4.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Cases heard: 14CF81 & 14CM105, Defendant Gorje M Ramirez in court with attorney Brian Severson.  Jane E Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed in felony case. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Information filed, reading waived. Defendant stood mute. Court entered not guilty plea, jury trial to be set. Bonds continued. Not guilty pleas entered in misdemeanor case also. Trials be set. Substitutions of Judge filed in both cases.
From atty Severson asking for 4-15-14 hearing at 2:45 to be rescheduled.

Bond amended: Defendant have no unsupervised contact with his own children that are minors. 
Conditions of no contact with children other than his own and that he not physically discipline any children are to remain in effect.
Bail/bond hearing on March 25, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
To Modify Bail filed by Atty Severson

standard felony conditions.  No contact with any of his children that are minors.  No contact with G.R., A.E.C., M.A.N.L., & D.L.L., No physical discipline of any children.

Defendant Gorje M Ramirez in court with attorney Amanda Kay Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases heard: 14CM105 and 14CF81.  $2500.00 signature bond,  standard felony conditions. Waives time limits.  No contact with any of his children that are minors.  No contact with G.R., A.E.C., M.A.N.L., & D.L.L., No physical discipline of any children.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 02:20 pm.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
